name: The Islamic Association of Arabi
mission: PROVIDED RELIGOUS SERVICE AND EDUCATION FOR CHILDREN.BENNETT SUPPORT FOR THE NEEDY BY USE OF ZAKAT MINISTRY.WEDDING AND FUNERAL SERVICE.
theoryOfChange: Provides places of worship, Islamic education (including Quran memorization and scholar training), and dawah/community programs to develop scholars/Imams who can serve Muslim communities and convey Islam clearly in the American context.

all_citations.claim: The organization reported total revenue of $2,357,167 and provides religious services, education, and funeral support.
The Islamic Association of Arabi manages community programs and religious services.
The association operates the Al-Hameed Boys Academy and Amatur Rahman Girls Academy.
The organization engages in religious and cultural community outreach.
The charity provides various donation options for general charitable giving.
Financial metrics include a 96.1% program expense ratio and 38.8 months of working capital.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 23/50, the charity offers a medium fit for donors interested in religious and cultural preservation [5].

While it maintains a robust program expense ratio of 96.1%, the overall impact score of 20/50 is limited by a lack of publicly available cost-per-beneficiary data and independent outcome assessments [1][7].

baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Association of Arabi is a religious organization dedicated to providing spiritual services, funeral support, and educational opportunities for children through the Al-Hameed Boys Academy and Amatur Rahman Girls Academy [1][4]. The association reported a total revenue of $2,357,167 and maintains a high program expense ratio of 96.1%, ensuring the majority of funds directly support its community missions [1][7].

strengths.detail: The organization directs all of its funding to its mission, maintaining a <cite id="1">96.1% program expense ratio</cite>, which significantly exceeds the <cite id="1">89.6% peer median</cite>.
The charity operates with remarkable fundraising efficiency, spending <cite id="7">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>.
The association has demonstrated robust financial expansion with a <cite id="1">42.3% revenue CAGR</cite> over the past three years.

strengths_deep_dive: The Islamic Association of Arabi demonstrates extraordinary financial efficiency in its operations. By maintaining a <cite id="1">96.1% program expense ratio</cite>, the organization ensures that every dollar spent goes directly toward its educational and religious services. This is further supported by its lean fundraising model, which requires <cite id="7">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization's financial trajectory is also strong, evidenced by its <cite id="1">$2,357,167 in total revenue</cite> and a <cite id="1">42.3% revenue CAGR</cite> over a three-year period.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="4">1985</cite>, the Islamic Association of Arabi is a religious organization dedicated to providing spiritual services, funeral support, and educational opportunities for children. The organization operates several core programs, including the <cite id="2">Al-Hameed Boys Academy</cite> and Amatur Rahman Girls Academy. In its most recent fiscal year, the association reported <cite id="1">$2,357,167 in total revenue</cite>. The charity operates with exceptional financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="1">96.1% program expense ratio</cite> and a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="7">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. Over the past three years, the organization has experienced significant growth, with a <cite id="1">42.3% revenue CAGR</cite>.
